msContents.summary: This is part one of two of a dictionary. Part one is a dictionary on nouns (pēyarakarāti = presumably peyarakarāti). Interestingly, the second part is the famous 'caturakarāti' by Beschi.

msItem.title: Dictionnaire Malabar
msItem.author: (presumably Beschi?)

filiation.p: Bnf Indien 229 contains the second part of this text.

extent.measure: 1 guard folio out of wood in the front.

supportDesc.foliation: Arabic numerals on the verso of each folio. Consistent.

handNote.desc: Even the short 'e' is rendered with a double 'kompu' that is used for the long 'ē'.

origin.origDate: No internal date. Dated to 1828 on the basis of the date of BnF Indien 229 (second part of this dictionary). Dated to 1828 by Vinson et al. (1866-) and to 1828 by Cabaton (1912).

acquisition.p: Acquired, July 22nd, 1833, from Philippe Ducler. See BnF, département des Manuscrits, inventaire 1 = Acquisitions: manuscrits et imprimés documentaires, 1833-1848, no. 70.

listBibl.bibl: Burnouf, Eugène (1832). Rapport fait au Conseil, dans la séance du 2 juillet 1832, sur les collections de manuscrits et de dessins rapportées de l’Inde par M. Ducler, administrateur de Carical, membre de la Société asiatique. Journal asiatique 10, p. 84-87. — See p. 87, n° 3.
Cabaton, Antoine (1912). Catalogue sommaire des manuscrits indiens, indo-chinois & malayo-polynésiens. Bibliothèque nationale. Département des manuscrits. Paris: E. Leroux. — See p. 37, nos. 228-229.
Vinson, Julien & Feer, Léon & s.n. (1866-). Catalogue des manuscrits tamoul et télinga. Manuscript, BnF Indien 577. — See f. 54rr, nos. 213-214 228-229.

encodingDesc.p: I have added puḷḷi-s in my transcription, and rendered even the hypercorrected 'ē' as such. Thus, I surmise that 'pēyarakarāti' is 'peyarakarāti' — the dictionary on nouns.
